pros:
Provided me with the training to help me identify gaps in students learning techniques. 

Customizable hours to fit around class schedule.

Tutoring solidified my understanding of my past classes.
cons: Cant think of any right now

review_title: The college has let go all of its librarians in a budget cut
job_title: Discovery and Systems Librarian in Albany, OR
pros: Prior to this budget cut, the environment was extremely collegial and very welcoming; I would have given 5 stars. Now, administration has set itself up against faculty and the situation is deteriorating rapidly.
cons: The budget cut just mentioned is eliminating all librarians, the entire computer science and criminal justice programs, and drastically curtailing services to offer educational paths to the community - a core part of a community college's mission.

review_title: great experience but could use better pay
pros: fun, flexible and friendly at the learning center.
cons: not a lot of money.

pros:
- flexible schedule
- remote
- fun team
- interesting work
cons: - far drive when I had to commute

pros: Collaborative, student success centered, progressive, and equitable values-based organization.
cons: Challenges with changing demographics of the community.

review_title: Good Job, especially if going to school
job_title: Instructional Assistant I in Albany, OR
pros:
Friendly/Positive Environment 
During downtime you can work on personal projects or homework
Meet people from several different fields while on the job
cons: You need to be able to work with people who don't understand technology well. A lot of the tech support calls are for simple things, so there will not be much of an intellectual challenge.

review_title: Good place to work as a student
pros: Flexible hours and good management
cons: There aren't any cons if you are a student

pros: Low stress, slow pace, nice staffs
cons: low pay, limited full time positions

pros: I loved working with such a diverse group of students, helping them to achieve their health goals and to progress toward their completion of a degree.
cons: Just a lack of security during these very challenging times we live in.

job_title: Computer Lab Specialist in Albany, OR
pros: Most people are fairly relaxed and easygoing. More emphasis is put on achieving deliverables than strict rule following.
cons: Institution can be slow to make changes, although this is true of any large organization to an extent.

pros: Flexible hours and great staff
cons: Low wages and limited to 20 hours a week

review_title: The most toxic work environment I have experienced.
pros: Working at Linn Benton Community College will provide you a salary.
cons: It's a toxic work environment. They are not up to code with health and safety. There is no communication or support.

pros: The food at the Cafeteria was top notch
cons: HR personnel were cold and unhelpful

job_title: Manager, Employment Services in Albany, OR
pros: This organization fosters a shared vision of providing quality education to students from all walks of life.  Collaboration with a focus on equity and opportunity for all students is a key component of our work here.  The organization strives to truly live up to the values they expound in their mission statement.
cons: The organization doesn't offer enough flexibility in class times.

job_title: Writing Center Tutor in Albany, OR
pros: Scheduling that works with your classes, a sweet and friendly staff, the knowledge that you're helping out folks, and good pay!
cons: I wouldn't call it easy work - sometimes students would be unwilling or upset with their assignments, but that was a *very* small percentage. This isn't a job that you can half-butt. Worth doing well!

pros: Some very nice folks work here. Nice campus in Lebanon, and not too stressful at first. The cafeteria has some pretty good food!!
cons: Management in the IT department is way behind and does not have your back at all!! Pay is very low for the IT positons and benefits are a joke!!! This is an ok position while you are looking for another job!! the LBCC website is one of the worst for a college, but hey you get what you pay for.

pros: Flexible schedule, friendly co-workers, summer classes, night classes, two campuses, great students, freedom to create your own curriculum, nice hours, fun work environment.
cons: Forced to be part-time, credit limits, no benefits, wish I could work more, too many part time teachers create confusion and scheduling errors. Mistakes with schedules and course texts.

job_title: Marketing Assistant in Pell City, AL
pros: I worked at LBCC as a marketing assistant.  I loved the people who worked there, very friendly and helpful.
cons: None to think of.  Working at a CC is a great experience

pros: You have flexibility with your work schedule, supportive coworkers, and it's pretty easy to get your foot in the door.
cons: There are few full-time positions, and the part-time ones are extremely part time.  Also part-timers aren't eligible for benefits.

pros: Keeps math and statistics skills sharp and ready.  Fun to work with students.  Great people in the learning center.
cons: Low hours and intermittent schedule due to the nature of the work.

job_title: Coffee Shop Manager in Albany, OR
pros: A great learning institution and a great place to apply you experience
cons: It takes a while to find a full time position

job_title: Sports Marketing Assistant in Albany, OR
pros: Fun, exciting and highly competitive.
cons: It was a student position and juggling school and work can be difficult at times.
